Message.Title: Correction Today or...

Message.Title: PULLING THE PLUG ON THE SMALL INVESTOR

Message.Title: ibm
Message.Msg: Watch techs a lot but never particularly pay attention to IBM. IBM is huge for a company I never hear about. I guess they just do a lot of tech work in the inner bowels of the corporate world that is invisible to the ordinary citizen or investor.

Topic.Title: Why Is Big Government, Big Deficit, Socialism So Popular In America

Message.Msg: Much of what Obama learned prior to his first election about speechmaking he learned from avowed socialist, Louis Farakkan. He learned that you speak to the American people EVERY DAY... and that if you say something over and over enough times that it will be viewed as correct and truthful regardless of the facts that underlie what you're saying. It's a brilliant tactic, and it's working well for Obama. For example, Obama always terms his desire for budget negotiations as being "balanced"... yet he has only proposed tax increases and almost no spending cuts. In fact, the January 1st agreement INCREASED spending. But Americans still view Obama as fair and balanced because even though it's hugely UN-balanced in favor of more spending and more taxes, he drills the idea that it IS balanced into Americans' heads every single day with a constant barrage of speeches... ... just like Louis Farakkan taught him to do. It's working. The deficits remain huge and out of control, unemployment remains high, and the fed is printing oceans of money. Obama is winning, and America is going bankrupt. S

Topic.Title: Why Is Big Government, Big Deficit, Socialism So Popular In America
